Package com.igormaznitsa.prol.exceptions

The package contains exceptions which are used by the Prol engine.

See:
          Description

Exception Summary
ParserException The exception describes an exception which can be thrown by a prol parser.
ProlAbstractCatcheableException The class describes a Prol Exception which can be catched with the catch/3 predicate and it can be throws with the throw/1 predicate.
ProlCustomErrorException The exception is a catcheable exception and it is mainly used to describe a non standard exceptions
ProlDomainErrorException The class implements the domain_error prolog exception.
ProlEvaluationErrorException The class describes the exception whicwill be thrown if there is any arithmetic exception in an evaluable predicate.
ProlException The class describes the root exception for all exceptions which can be thrown by a Prol engne in diffirent situations.
ProlExistenceErrorException The class describes the existence_error prolog exception.
ProlForkExecutionException The class describes a fork exception.
ProlHaltExecutionException The class describes the exception which will be thrown by a Prol engine when the halt/1 predicate has been found.
ProlInstantiationErrorException The class describes a instantiation prolog exception.
ProlKnowledgeBaseException The class describes a prol engine exception which will be thrown if there is any error in the work with a prol knowledge base.
ProlPermissionErrorException The class describes the permission_error prolog exception.
ProlRepresentationErrorException The class describes the prolog representation_error exception.
ProlTypeErrorException The class describes the prolog type_error exception.
ProlWrongGoalException The class describes a Prol exception which will be thrown if there is any error during the goal processing on the parsing or logical level.
 

Error Summary
ProlCriticalError The class describes a critical error after which a prol engine can't work and will be stopped
 

Package com.igormaznitsa.prol.exceptions Description

The package contains exceptions which are used by the Prol engine.
